channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged branch dangerously overhanging path, 30th June
item.description:
I noticed a half broken branch on a tree. This is directly over the public path and could brake at any point On lake side of path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed frame, 30th June
item.description:
Dumped this evening around 9.30 my camera did not pick up who dumped it there 65 Cambridge Road, SE20

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working - not fixed yet, 30th June
item.description:
Since a couple of weeks all the lights on the poles stopped working. there are still other wall lights but are very dim so the whole area now is dark and feel very unsafe. There are often homeless people loitering in the area so can we please prioritise this? It was marked as fixed but the lights are still off! some of them are on during the day and off during the night or they lights very briefely at odds hour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1 - 12, Blissett Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unhygienic Rubbish Storage, 30th June
item.description:
These people do not store their rubbish properly. 1 day after bin collection, the area is a mess, rubbish not stored securely, attracting pests and it smells (worse now in summer). They have been warned numerous times and do not improve.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): College Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously cut large tree, 30th June
item.description:
Outside 877 879 East Rochester Way a large tree on the verge between A2 and the pavement. The trunk of this tree has been partially cut through about 2ft from ground , with a chainsaw. If there are high winds, it might fall either onto the pavement or onto the A2.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 897, East Rochester Way, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cast iron trough type drainage ditch protrudes above pavement surface, 30th June
item.description:
The protruding drain is a trip hazard and is loose within it’s aggregate bedding which is insufficient in depth.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princes Road, Penge, London

item.title: Other area rubbish is been deposited in our bins, 30th June
item.description:
Other areas rubbish are being deposited in our bins. On Sunday a man in a pedalo rubbish vehicle was bringing rubbish to our bins. By Sunday evening the bins are overflowing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Shouldham Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Flat 18 Health Hazard, 30th June
item.description:
This flat's garden is not hygienic. It is full of discarded rubbish and attracts foxes and rats. I can hear them most evenings and I am concerned about rat borne diseases such as Weil's disease. I have a flat above this property and it is an eyesore.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): College Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins outside 49 Vanbrugh Park, 30th June
item.description:
These bins are usually emptied fairly regularly but haven’t been for well over a week. The overflowing rubbish smells in the heat and the wind has started to blow the rubbish into our driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Vanbrugh Park, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Drain full of rubbish after water main burst and road repair, 30th June
item.description:
Following the burst main and subsequent road repair - the drain is blocked with rubble. Concerns from Crawford Mansions Residents that the blocked drain will cause flooding as the road slope from the Old Marylebone Road. At the other end of Homer Row, the junction slopes down to this rubble filled street drain. Requires cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Crawford Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet
